My Projects

Check out my journey as a CS student...

Python, HTML, CSS, Django

This Django-based auction web app lets users create listings with titles, descriptions, starting bids, optional images, and categories.
Users can view active listings, place bids with validation, comment, manage a personal watchlist, and close auctions they created.
Listing, watchlist, and category pages help users browse and track items, while the admin interface allows full management of listings, bids, and comments.

Project Overview On GitHub

SQL, ERD

This SQLite database models players, games, characters, and tournament results for 1v1 fighting game events, with a normalized schema that enforces relationships through foreign keys.
It supports tracking of each player's tournament appearances, character choices, and final placements, while accounting for different game mechanics and archetypes.
Indexed fields optimize common search queries, enabling flexible analysis of performance trends by player, character, game, or archetype.

Project Overview On GitHub

Regex, Python, Django, HTML, CSS

This wiki encyclopedia web app lets users create, edit, search, and view entries written in Markdown, which I converted to HTML using my own regex-based parser instead of a library.
Users can browse all entries, view specific ones by title, search for exact or partial matches, and create new entries with title validation.
Each entry can be edited with pre-filled content, and a random page feature allows easy discovery.

Project Overview On GitHub

Python, Flask, SQL, HTML, CSS

This Flask app lets users track their ranked progress in fighting games through a dynamic, single-page interface built with SQL, JavaScript, and Plotly.
Pages adapt to the selected game using AJAX requests, allowing seamless updates without full reloads.
Ranking history is visualized with line charts that handle both numeric and non-numeric data, and all information is managed through a normalized, scalable database designed to support new games and characters with minimal code changes.

Project Overview On GitHub

HTML, CSS

This project recreates key Google search pages with a strong focus on mimicking Google's visual style using custom CSS.
I used flexbox and grid layout strategically to center and align elements like the search bar, buttons, and forms, closely reflecting Google's structure.
Rounded inputs, spacing, and color choices were carefully styled to match the original design, with consistent navigation links across pages reinforcing the overall layout.

Project Overview On GitHub

JavaScript, Fetch API, Python, Django

This single-page email client uses JavaScript, HTML, and CSS with all functionality contained in one JavaScript file.
I leveraged fetch requests to interact with the backend for sending, retrieving, archiving, and replying to emails, enabling smooth view changes without page reloads.
Dynamic DOM manipulation and event handling update mailbox contents, email views, and the compose form, while CSS controls layout and visibility for a responsive, seamless user experience.
